title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: Unless ’re alternative tunings, first question probably “Alternative ?” course, depends culture call home. Americans native English speakers, Europeans, mass-market popular music creators audiences nearly everywhere, music tuned 12-tone equal temperament, abbreviated “12-TET”. also see tuning referred “12-EDO”, stands “twelve equal divisions octave.” alternatives? two main sources alternative tunings: cultures, Music theorists / composers / instrument builders / performers within ancient Greek / Italian / French / German mainstream (nationalist enhancements!) now uses 12-EDO. brevity ’ll call “Western theoretical tunings”.

title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: Notable examples tunings cultures Indonesian gamelan tuning, South Indian carnatic music, various makams Ottoman music. can find detailed analyses gamelan tunings, well Thai classical tunings numerous theoretical practical tunings (Sethares 2013). first edition book (Sethares 1998) book sent alternate tunings rabbit hole 2001.

title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: Numerous tunings temperaments derived theorists, composers, performers time. happened first steps along path ancient Greek music 12-EDO claiming dominant market share today, later counter said market share. cases, instrument builders constructed moderately complex instruments used tunings. desire mass-produce musical instruments, especially piano, led widespread adoption 12-EDO standard. two main types alternative tunings use today: Equal divisions period, usually octave, Just intonation.

what: Brief guide to tuning and scales
title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: moving onward, need define concepts. Pitches (sort ) musical name frequencies. Frequencies rate string air column reed membrane loudspeaker physical object vibrates. Frequencies designated cycles per second, called Hertz abbreviated Hz. typical range human hearing 20 - 20,000 Hertz, range commonly used music. tuning describes set pitches composer selects writing piece, often dictated instruments used play . Tunings usually consist set repetitions scale. scale set pitches ascending order frequency. common tuning type equal divisions octave twelve notes, generally called “N-TET” “N-EDO”. example, quarter-tone tunings 24-EDO. Musicians create tunings kind variety reasons, often provide harmonic possibilities without giving ability modulate different keys. Two tunings achieved serious usage 19-EDO 31-EDO. ’re curious tunings, function et_scale_table package can create scale tables , function keyboard_map can create mapping scale synthesizer keyboard. ’s 19-EDO scale table keyboard map look like:

title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: main class derived tunings called just intonation. Just intonation attempts create perfect harmonies dividing octave unequal intervals using ratios small integers. example, just perfect fifth 3/2, just perfect fourth 4/3, just major third 5/4. ’ve heard barbershop quartet, ’ve heard just intonation. Combination product sets form just intonation.

title: Introduction to Combination Product Sets
text: Combination product sets (Narushima 2019, chap. 6) just one theoretician Erv Wilson’s tuning constructs. current release, v0.5.0, focused , ability play music synthesizers can retuned, Korg Minilogue XD, Aodyo Anyma Phi, Ashun Sound Machines Hydrasynth.

title: Tetrads of the 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany on a 37-key Synthesizer
Tetrads of the 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany on a 37-key Synthesizer
Tetrads of the 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany on a 37-key Synthesizer
Tetrads of the 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany on a 37-key Synthesizer
code: scale_degrees <- length(scale$degree) - 1 base_note_number = 48 chord_names <- chords$chord degrees <- chords$degrees degrees_matrix <- matrix(   unlist(lapply(strsplit(degrees, ":"), as.numeric)),   byrow = TRUE,   nrow = length(degrees) )  for (ichord in 1:nrow(degrees_matrix)) {   chord_vector <- degrees_matrix[ichord, ]   title_string <- paste(     "Chord =",     chord_names[ichord],     ", Degrees =",     degrees[ichord],     ", Base C =",     base_note_number,     ", Scale degrees =",     scale_degrees,     sep = " "   )   piano_plot <- chord_plot(     chord_vector, title_string, map, base_note_number   )   print(piano_plot) }

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {eikosany: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets},   author = {M. Edward (Ed) Borasky},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.4.9.9000},   url = {https://algocompsynth.github.io/eikosany/}, }

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: eikosany R package tools algorithmic composition Erv Wilson’s Combination Product Sets (Narushima 2019, chap. 6). ’s meant complement microtonal composition tools, replace . name: Eikosany 20-note scale derived Erv Wilson six harmonic factors. Although six factors can used, commonly encountered Eikosany uses first six odd numbers: 1, 3, 5, 7, 9 11.

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: Scala. Note: Scala multi-paradigm programming language runs Java Virtual Machine. specialized tool working musical scales. Sevish’s Scale Workshop. web-based tool working musical scales. Leimma Apotome. tools, Khyam Allami Counterpoint, browser-based applications creating microtonal scales making generative music . ODDSound MTS-ESP. plugin digital audio workstations (DAWs) facilitates production microtonal music. copy ’re making microtonal electronic music, . Eikosany scales Erv Wilson developed ship MTS-ESP, don’t really need R package compose . Entonal Studio. Entonal Studio user interface package microtonal composition. can operate standalone application, plugin host plugin. copy Entonal Studio recommend highly. Infinitone DMT. Infinitone DMT FAQ: “Infinitone DMT DAW plugin standalone empowers musicians easily use micro-tuning within workflow. … “plugin, Infinitone DMT inserted DAW MIDI effect. … standalone can used separately DAW, can used conjunction DAW routing MIDI data DAW standalone (back).” Universal Tuning Editor. Universal Tuning Editor application computing visualizing microtonal scales tunings, includes tools interface hardware software synthesizers. Wilsonic. free app runs iOS devices. don’t iOS devices ’ve never used . also version Wilsonic development use ODDSound MTS-ESP. See https://wilsonic.co/downloads/downloads-mts-esp/ details. Surge XT. Surge XT open source full featured software synthesizer. Surge XT community invested significant level effort supporting alternate tuning systems. See Xenharmonic Wiki List microtonal software plugins ways making microtonal music.

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: February 4, 2001, composer Iannis Xenakis passed away. ’ve fan experimental music, especially musique concrète, algorithmically composed music, microtonal music, avant-garde genres since undergraduate. Xenakis one major figures algorithmic composition. Reading first edition Tuning, Timbre, Spectrum, Scale 1 rekindled appreciation microtonal music Harry Partch. , armed copies Sethares (1998), Formalized Music 2, Genesis Music 3, embarked path led Harry Met Iannis 4. Harry Met Iannis premiered microtonal music festival El Paso, Texas late October, 2001. Bandcamp version essentially identical version; source code GitHub https://github.com/AlgoCompSynth/-harry-met-iannis. festival, met number composers working microtonal just intonation, one name kept coming : Erv Wilson. Wilson theoretician developed keyboards, scales tuning systems several composers using time, still using today. Terumi Narushima’s Microtonality Tuning Systems Erv Wilson 5 comprehensive documentation Wilson’s work basis much code package.

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: two main motivations: ’s old saying really want learn something, teach computer . case Erv Wilson’s musical constructs, teasing construction processes others’ writings subject non-trivial task. example, much Wilson’s work consists multi-dimensional graph structures drawn flat paper. build physical three-dimensional models , can’t even rendered three dimensions. graph theory operations generated musical ways traverse obvious. 20th anniversary Xenakis’ passing Harry Met Iannis occured second year virtual isolation COVID-19. 2021, acquired two synthesizers capable mapping keyboards arbitrary microtonal scales: Ashun Sound Machines Hydrasynth Desktop, Korg Minilogue XD. Hydrasynth ships tuning tables many Erv Wilson’s scales already firmware. Minilogue XD, user can load six custom scales software librarian program. ’m keyboard player, even , remapping process scales leaves middle C musician normally expect find . notes somewhere else. need translator music want write doesn’t involve lot trial error fumbling around remapped synthesizer -screen keyboard. CPS scales aimed harmonic musical structures like chords, finding remapped keyboard tedious error-prone. Music composed using Wilson’s musical structures mostly played instruments custom-built . keyboards designed Wilson’s microtonal music; indeed, Wilson designed microtonal keyboards (Narushima 2019, chap. 2). ’re quite expensive , like instruments, custom-built. need tools work .

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: presented project current state Cascadia R Conference August 19th, 2023. slides sample data https://github.com/AlgoCompSynth/eikosany-slides. now begun calling “Great Refactor”. Approximate road map: “Finish” consonaR. moving scale, keyboard, interval, spectral analysis synthesis functionality eikosany consonaR. also adding functionality consonaR facilitate algorithmic composition frequency domain. may include real-time synthesis capability can find way make work Windows, MacOS, Ubuntu 22.04 LTS Raspberry Pi OS. definitely include current synthesis functionality based seewave tuneR. Replace much low-level functionality eikosany calls equivalents consonaR. Removing MIDI functionality eikosany. First , performing composed microtonal music hardware software synthesizers support solved problem, using tools listed . Second, MIDI terrible score language kind music want make. Open Sound Control (OSC) may better, ’m convinced. ’d much prefer language facilitates live coding / performance human / computer interface communication protocol like MIDI OSC. CLAMS approach.

title: Algorithmic Composition With Erv Wilson's Combination Product Sets
text: ’re interested helping development package, notes: can install package via remotes::install("eikosany"), easier fork repository https://github.com/AlgoCompSynth/eikosany.git install via devtools::install(dependencies = TRUE). don’t recommend using package without RStudio; may well hidden dependencies . regularly run R CMD check . tracking Wilsonic MTS-ESP Surge XT less constantly re-scoping project avoid duplicating capabilities. get feature request ’s covered one , ’ll likely send . another project works ramping September. CLAMS Forth-based real-time synthesis toolset embedded environments. development time divided two projects. integrations two projects, mostly can use R Markdown Quarto literate programming documentation, synthesizer can make algorithmic microtonal music.

what: Note names for equal-tempered Bohlen-Pierce scale — bohlen_pierce_et_names

Note names for equal-tempered Bohlen-Pierce scale — bohlen_pierce_et_names
text: character vector 13 elements

title: Note names for equal-tempered Bohlen-Pierce scale — bohlen_pierce_et_names
text: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bohlen%E2%80%93Pierce_scale#Intervals_and_scale_diagrams

title: Note names for equal-tempered Bohlen-Pierce scale — bohlen_pierce_et_names
text: Even 2023, code often breaks given characters outside 7-bit international standard. even flats, let alone half-flats, half-sharps, naturals, symbols alternate tuning theorists proposed. scales created equal divisions octave, use "/b" half-flat, "b" flat, "bb" double-flat, /#" half-sharp, "#" sharp. "##" double-sharp. Thanks advance understanding.

title: Create Chord WAV Files — chord_WAVs
text: Creates WAV files inversions chord two notes

title: Create Chord WAV Files — chord_WAVs
code: chord_WAVs(   chord,   keyboard_map,   lowest_note = 48,   highest_note = 84,   output_directory = "~/Multisample",   signal = "tria",   duration_sec = 1,   velocity = 100,   sample_rate_hz = 48000,   bit_width = 24 )

title: Create Chord WAV Files — chord_WAVs
text: chord numeric vector scale degrees chord keyboard_map keyboard map scale lowest_note lowest MIDI note number use, default 48. highest_note highest MIDI note number use, default 84. output_directory character, default "~/Multisample". created exist. signal seewave signal type, default "tria" duration_sec long hold note, default = 4 velocity MIDI velocity, default = 100, max 127 sample_rate_hz sample rate hz, default = 48000 bit_width bit width samples, default = 24

title: Create Chord WAV Files — chord_WAVs
text: full path output_directory

title: Create Chord WAV Files — chord_WAVs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ eikosany <- cps_scale_table() eikosany_chords <- cps_chord_table(eikosany) eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany) chord_degrees <- eikosany_chords$degrees for (i in 1:length(chord_degrees)) {   chord <- as.numeric(unlist(strsplit(chord_degrees[i], ":")))   folder_name <-     paste0("~/eikosany-chords/chord-", gsub(":", "-", chord_degrees[i]))   print(paste0("generating WAVs in folder ", folder_name))   chord_WAVs(     chord,     keyboard_map = eikosany_map,     lowest_note = 40,     highest_note = 80,     output_directory = folder_name   ) } } # }

title: Create Chord Music Object — chord_music_object
text: chord numeric vector scale degrees chord keyboard_map keyboard map scale lowest_note lowest MIDI note number use. Default 48. highest_note highest MIDI note number use. Default 84. tempo numeric, beats per minute, default 60 hold_beats numeric number beats hold chord, default 1

title: Create Chord Music Object — chord_music_object
text: music object

title: Create Chord Music Object — chord_music_object
text: created music object contains single line inversions chord given lowest highest notes keyboard map.

title: Create Chord Music Object — chord_music_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   eikosany <- cps_scale_table()   eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany)   print(eikosany_music_object <- chord_music_object(     c(1, 6, 11, 15),      eikosany_map,      lowest_note = 40,      highest_note = 80   ))    vanilla <- et_scale_table()   vanilla_map <- keyboard_map(vanilla)   print(vanilla_music_object <- chord_music_object(     c(0, 4, 7, 10),      vanilla_map   )) } # }

title: Create Chord Plot — chord_plot
text: Creates ggplot2 object plot chord

title: Create Chord Plot — chord_plot
text: chord numeric vector scale degrees chord title_string string use plot title. usually chord name chord table keyboard_map keyboard map scale base_note_number routine assumes 37-key synth keyboard, leftmost key emitting MIDI note number C. Thus, base_note_number must equal zero modulo 12. default 48, C middle C. Minilogue XD set factory reset.

title: Create Chord Plot — chord_plot
text: ggplot2 object can printed

title: Create Chord Plot — chord_plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   eikosany <- cps_scale_table()   eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany)   print(chord_plot(     c(1, 6, 11, 15),      "1:3:5:7",      eikosany_map,      48   )) } # }

title: Synthesize a Chord — chord_synth
text: chord vector frequencies chord signal seewave signal type: "sine", "tria", "square" "saw", default = "tria" duration_sec many seconds hold note, default = 1 velocity MIDI velocity, default = 100, max 127 sample_rate_hz sample rate hz, default = 48000 bit_width bit width samples, default = 24

title: Synthesize a Chord — chord_synth
text: full path output_directory

title: Synthesize a Chord — chord_synth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ justmajor7th <- c(1, 5/4, 3/2, 7/4) wave <- chord_synth(256*justmajor7th, duration_sec = 10) tuneR::play(wave) } # }

title: Create CPS Chord Table — cps_chord_table
text: Creates chord table combination product set scale based even number harmonic factors.

title: Create CPS Chord Table — cps_chord_table
text: scale_table CPS scale table based even number harmonic factors. abort via stop("number harmonic factors must even!") receives one odd number.

title: Create CPS Chord Table — cps_chord_table
text: data.table four columns: chord: chord expressed colon-separated harmonics. subharmonic chord prefixed "~". degrees: chord expressed colon-separated scale degrees chord_index: row number chord combination output is_subharm: zero harmonic, one subharmonic. resulting data.table sorted harmonic-subharmonic pairs using data.table::setkey.

title: Create CPS Chord Table — cps_chord_table
text: algorithm used works combination product set built even number harmonic factors, aborts receives one odd number. following, symbol n)m Erv Wilson's notation number combinations m items taken n time. n_harmonics number harmonic factors, resulting chords choose <- n_harmonics / 2 + 1 notes. choose)n_harmonics "harmonic" chords choose)n_harmonics "sub-harmonic" chords.

what: Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
title: Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
text: Creates scale table combination product set definition

title: Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
text: harmonics vector harmonics use - defaults first six odd numbers, harmonics define 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany. choose number harmonics choose combination - defaults 3, number harmonics combination Eikosany. root_divisor divisor scales one products 1/1. published CPS scales just use smallest products , Erv Wilson used 1x3x11 Eikosany, maps 1x5x11 concert pitches : 55, 110, 220, 440 etc. default value.

title: Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
text: data.table six columns: note_name: product harmonics defines note (character) ratio: ratio defines note, number >= 1 < 2 ratio_frac: ratio vulgar fraction (character) ratio_cents: ratio cents (hundredths semitone) interval_cents: interval note previous note degree: scale degree zero (number notes) - 1

title: Create Combination Product Set Scale Table — cps_scale_table
Note names for 12EDO — edo12_names
text: scale tables created using function et_scale_table, user must specify note names. convenience, eikosany package includes data sets 12EDO, 19EDO, 31EDO.

title: Note names for 12EDO — edo12_names
text: character vector 12 elements

title: Note names for 12EDO — edo12_names
text: music theory class

title: Note names for 12EDO — edo12_names
text: Even 2023, code often breaks given characters outside 7-bit international standard. even flats, let alone half-flats, half-sharps, naturals, symbols alternate tuning theorists proposed. scales created equal divisions octave, use "/b" half-flat, "b" flat, "bb" double-flat, /#" half-sharp, "#" sharp. "##" double-sharp. Thanks advance understanding.

title: Create Equal-Tempered Scale Table — et_scale_table
text: Creates scale table equal divisions specified period.

title: Create Equal-Tempered Scale Table — et_scale_table
text: note_names character vector names notes scale. default names standard 12 equal divisions octave. period period - default 2, octave

title: Create Equal-Tempered Scale Table — et_scale_table
text: data.table six columns: note_name: note name (character) ratio: ratio defines note, number 1 period ratio_frac: ratio vulgar fraction (character). ratios EDOs irrational, approximation. ratio_cents: ratio cents (hundredths semitone) interval_cents: interval note previous note degree: scale degree zero (number notes) - 1

title: Export Music Object — export_music_object
text: Exports gm music object MIDI file

title: Export Music Object — export_music_object
text: music_object gm music object file_name character ".mid" suffix supplied output_directory character, default "~/MIDI". created exist.

title: Export Music Object — export_music_object
text: full path file

title: Export Music Object — export_music_object
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   eikosany <- cps_scale_table()   eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany)   print(eikosany_music_object <- chord_music_object(     c(1, 6, 11, 15),      eikosany_map,      lowest_note = 40,      highest_note = 80   ))   print(file_path <- export_music_object(     eikosany_music_object,     "eikosany_chords"   ))    vanilla <- et_scale_table()   vanilla_map <- keyboard_map(vanilla)   print(vanilla_music_object <- chord_music_object(     c(0, 4, 7, 10),      vanilla_map   ))   print(file_path <- export_music_object(     vanilla_music_object,     "vanilla_chords"   )) } # }

title: Create Interval Table — interval_table
text: Creates interval table scale table

title: Create Interval Table — interval_table
text: scale_table scale table ps_scale_table, cps_scale_table, et_scale_table

title: Create Interval Table — interval_table
text: interval table. data.table seven columns name "" note from_degree scale degree "" note name "" note to_degree scale degree "" note ratio interval number ratio_frac interval vulgar fraction (character) ratio_cents interval cents

title: Create Keyboard Map — keyboard_map
text: Creates keyboard map

title: Create Keyboard Map — keyboard_map
text: scale_table scale table ps_scale_table, cps_scale_table, et_scale_table middle_c_octave octave number middle C. varying conventions octave number middle C. default function 4, software can use 3 even number

title: Create Keyboard Map — keyboard_map
text: keyboard map. data.table eight columns: note_number: MIDI note number .NN_MIN .NN_MAX name_12edo: note name key 12EDO. key normally press play note number octave_12edo: octave key normally plays note_name: note name scale table ratio_frac: ratio note vulgar fraction. Note equal tempered scales usually approximation irrational number. algorithm used appears give six decimal places accuracy. degree: scale degree note octave: octave number note freq: frequency Hz cents: cents lowest MIDI note .NN_MIN, frequency .FREQ_MIN. ref_keyname: synthesizers, including Korg Minilogue XD, let retune key offset cents another reference key. column name reference key. ref_octave: octave number reference key ref_offset: offset cents reference key

title: Create Keyboard Map — keyboard_map
text: function currently hard-coded compute map middle C frequency .FREQ_MIDDLE_Cis mapped MIDI note number .NN_MIDDLE_C scale degree 0. current constants 12EDO A440 note 69. note 6000 cents MIDI note number 0 12EDO. Normally use remap keyboard scale 12 notes per octave. scales 12 fewer notes octave, easier remap octaves using offsets computed offset_matrix!

title: Create Minilogue XD .scl File — minilogue_xd_scl_file
text: keyboard_map keyboard map created keyboard_map output_file_path path file write permission scale_description tell user scale . default includes link pkgdown website package.

title: Create Minilogue XD .scl File — minilogue_xd_scl_file
text: character vector containing data written file. element vector line ASCII text.

title: Create Minilogue XD .scl File — minilogue_xd_scl_file
text: Korg Minilogue XD can microtuned two ways: 1. user octave: octaves synthesizer retuned using offsets cents 12EDO notes. scales 12 fewer notes, hexany dekany, work, can use offset_matrix function compute settings required. easy either synthesizer using Korg minilogue XD Sound Librarian. 2. user scale: microtunes whole MIDI keyboard MIDI note numbers zero 127. need use method eikosany, since 20 notes. standard process microtune user scale use Korg minilogue xd Sound Librarian. load Scala .scl file .scl .kbm file scale librarian upload synthesizer. .scl files minilogue_xd_scl_file designed remap entire keyboard just .scl file. See vignette "Tuning Korg Minilogue XD 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany" details.

title: Create Minilogue XD .scl File — minilogue_xd_scl_file
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # `cps_scale_table` returns the 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany by default eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(cps_scale_table()) file_contents <- minilogue_xd_scl_file(   eikosany_map,   "~/minilogue-xd-eikosany.scl",    "Eikosany 1-3-5-7-9-11" ) } # }

title: Create Offset Matrix — offset_matrix
text: Creates offset matrix scale table. offset matrix used retune octave synthesizers support retunings, like Korg Minilogue XD Dirtywave M8 tracker.

title: Create Offset Matrix — offset_matrix
text: scale_table scale table

title: Create Offset Matrix — offset_matrix
text: offset matrix. Columns represent key names 12-tone equal temperament. Rows represent note names scale table. value matrix cell offset cents need apply column name's key get row name's scale note.

title: Create Offset Matrix — offset_matrix
text: columns offset matrix represent key names 12-tone equal temperament. Rows represent note names scale table. value matrix cell offset cents need apply column name's key get row name's scale note. example, value row "3x9" column "C#" 104, tune "C#" key 104 cents play "3x9". value row "1x7", column "D#" -33, tune "D#" key 33 cents. Keep mind can use 12-TET key , end key notes scale. strategy use : scales seven fewer notes, retune white keys starting C, retune left-white keys last note scale. hexany, fun stick extra note somewhere. scales 8 12 notes, retune keys left right, sometimes adding notes fill 12. example Microtonality Tuning Systems Erv Wilson, pages 127 - 131. example worked examples grady_a grady_b function ps_scale_table.

what: Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table
title: Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table
text: Creates scale table product set definition

title: Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table
Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table
text: ps_def product set scale definition. character vector products. product set number integers separated lower-case "x". example, ps_def 1-3-5-7 Hexany c("1x3", "1x5", "1x7", "3x5", "3x7", "5x7") default ps_def 1-3-5-7-9-11 Eikosany. root_divisor divisor scales one products 1/1. published CPS scales just use smallest products , Erv Wilson used 1x3x11 Eikosany, maps 1x5x11 concert pitches : 55, 110, 220, 440 etc. default value.

title: Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table
text: data.table six columns: note_name: given product set definition, re-ordered degrees resulting scale (character) ratio: ratio defines note, number 1 2 ratio_frac: ratio vulgar fraction (character) ratio_cents: ratio cents (hundredths semitone) interval_cents: interval note previous note degree: scale degree zero (number notes) - 1

title: Create Product Set Scale Table — ps_scale_table

what: Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
title: Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
text: Make WAV files chords given CPS

title: Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
text: scale_table scale table CPS home_folder chord rendered sub-folder one

title: Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
text: full path output_directory

title: Render the Chords of a CPS — render_cps_chords
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  (hexany_scale_table <- cps_scale_table(   harmonics = c(1, 3, 5, 7),   choose = 2 )) (render_cps_chords(hexany_scale_table, "~/hexany_chords"))  (eikosany_scale_table <- cps_scale_table()) (render_cps_chords(eikosany_scale_table, "~/eikosany_chords"))  } # }

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
text: Creates multisample 1010music Blackbox given section keyboard map.

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
code: scale_multisample(   keyboard_map,   start_note_number,   end_note_number,   output_directory = "~/Multisample",   duration_sec = 1,   velocity = 100,   sample_rate_hz = 48000,   bit_width = 24,   signal = "tria" )

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
text: keyboard_map keyboard map scale eikosany::keyboard_map start_note_number starting MIDI note number scale end_note_number ending MIDI note number scale output_directory character, default "~/Multisample". created exist. duration_sec long hold note, default = 1 velocity MIDI velocity, default = 100, max 127 sample_rate_hz sample rate hz, default = 48000 bit_width bit width samples, default = 24 signal seewave signal type, default "tria"

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
text: full path output_directory

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
text: 1010music Blackbox small music sampling studio. One features ability connect synthesizer collect multisample. multisample set WAV files fixed duration set MIDI note numbers, note number, set velocities. default velocity 100; maximum possible velocity 127. default WAV format 24 bits sample rate 48 kHz.

title: Create Scale Multisample — scale_multisample
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   eikosany <- cps_scale_table()   eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany)    # typical 37-key synthesizer   path <- scale_multisample(eikosany_map, 48, 84)   print(path) } # }

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
text: Creates multisample 1010music Blackbox given section keyboard map.

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
code: scale_sawtooth_multisample(   keyboard_map,   start_note_number,   end_note_number,   output_directory = "~/Multisample",   duration_sec = 1,   velocity = 100,   sample_rate_hz = 48000,   bit_width = 24 )

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
text: keyboard_map keyboard map scale eikosany::keyboard_map start_note_number starting MIDI note number scale end_note_number ending MIDI note number scale output_directory character, default "~/Multisample". created exist. duration_sec long hold note, default = 1 velocity MIDI velocity, default = 100, max 127 sample_rate_hz sample rate hz, default = 48000 bit_width bit width samples, default = 24

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
text: full path output_directory

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
text: 1010music Blackbox small music sampling studio. One features ability connect synthesizer collect multisample. multisample set WAV files fixed duration set MIDI note numbers, note number, set velocities. default velocity 100; maximum possible velocity 127. default WAV format 24 bits sample rate 48 kHz.

title: Create Scale Sawtooth Multisample — scale_sawtooth_multisample
code: if (FALSE) {   eikosany <- cps_scale_table()   eikosany_map <- keyboard_map(eikosany)    # typical 37-key synthesizer   path <- scale_sawtooth_multisample(eikosany_map, 48, 84)   print(path) }
